meanings.sent1: The teacher will reprehend the student for talking during class.
meanings.sent2: Parents often reprehend their children for not doing their homework.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to reprehend the dog for stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The judge had to reprehend the lawyer for his disrespectful behavior in court.
meanings.sent5: The coach will reprehend any player who breaks the team rules.

meanings.definition: To criticize or find fault with
meanings.sent1: It is not right to reprehend someone without understanding their situation.
meanings.sent2: Some people constantly reprehend others without offering any solutions.
meanings.sent3: The robot started to reprehend the programmer for the errors in its code.
meanings.sent4: She couldn't help but reprehend herself for forgetting her friend's birthday.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor will reprehend any mistakes made by the employees.
